dialogue.content: Welcome to ElectraCITY!
The goal of the game is to power the city in the cheapest way possible.
Direct power from the generators to the buildings.
You need to connect wires between generators and the buildings.
There are three kinds of wires, and each cost $ to connect.
Blue wires are the cheapest.
However they have high electrical resistance.
Resistance will be explained in a little bit!
Red wires are more expensive than blue wires.
They cost more, but they have lower resistance than blue wires.
Yellow wires are the MOST expensive.
They are very powerful as they have no resistance!
To explain how resistance works, let's start powering some buildings!
Click on the blue wire to select it.
Now click on the circles below the power generator.
Drag the connected wire to a nearby building, and click over a circle to plug it in.
Congratulations! You have powered your first building!
Let's expand the power grid and provide power another building.
Connect a blue wire between the powered building, and a nearby unpowered building!
Electricity can travel from one building to the next.
This way, you can extend the reach of power from the generator!
Continue to connect buildings together with blue wires.
Uh-oh! A wire was connected, but the building did not receive power.
This is because the total resistance of connect wires cannot allow for more electricity to flow further.
When using wires with resistance, the amount of electricity leaving the building to the next one will be lower.
Let's lower the resistance of the circuit!
Grab the wire connected to the generator, then right-click to delete it.
Now replace the deleted blue wire with a red one instead!
Red wires have lower resistance than blue wires.
This means there is more electricity leaving the powered building than when you used the blue wire!
You now know the basics of ElectraCITY!
Press finish whenever you feel ready.
Feel free to try out the yellow wire.
Or you return to the main menu and press START to try a real game!
CLOSE DIALOGUE
